nova-v-project-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-project-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-project-item__title nova-v-project-item__title--clamp-3"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="project/Capacity-Analysis-of-Ambient-Backscatter-Communication-Systems">Capacity Analysis of Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-project-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-project-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-project-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-project-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-project-item__badges-item"><span class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-project-item__status">Project</span></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-project-item__meta-right"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-project-item__stack-item"><div><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-project-item__description nova-v-project-item__description--clamp-3">As an emerging technology, ambient backscatter
exploits the environmental radio frequency (RF) signals to
enable passive devices to communicate with each other. One
important performance metric for ambient backscatter is channel
capacity. This paper address the capacity problem of an ambient
backscatter communication system with a reader and a passive
tag.</div><button class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-m nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto"><span class="nova-c-button__label">[...more]</span></button></div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-project-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-project-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack content="scientific-contributions/2113530295_Wen_Chen"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this letter, joint transmission power and bandwidth allocation is investigated for multiple pairs of secondary users in a cognitive underlay system. In the investigated system, the interference channel’s statistics, including mean and variance, may change over time. It is assumed that a limit number of historical measurements of the interference channel’s mean and variance are available. Based on the measurements, a minimum-volume elliptical region is used to describe the uncertainty of the interference channel’s mean and variance. Sum capacity of multiple secondary users is maximized while limiting the worst-case interference outage probability. The worst-case interference outage probability is over the interference channel gain’s distribution, which is subject to the uncertain mean and variance in the elliptical region. An optimization problem is formulated, which is non-convex. The formulated non-convex optimization problem is decomposed into two levels. In each level, only a convex problem is required to be solved. Then the global optimal solution can be achieved. Numerical results are presented to verify the effectiveness of our method. IEEE</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Signal Ratio Detection and Approximate Performance Analysis for Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems with Multiple Receiving Antennas"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-12-13"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/321788459_Signal_Ratio_Detection_and_Approximate_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_with_Multiple_Receiving_Antennas"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/321788459_Signal_Ratio_Detection_and_Approximate_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_with_Multiple_Receiving_Antennas" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Signal Ratio Detection and Approximate Performance Analysis for Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems with Multiple Receiving Antennas</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/321788459_Signal_Ratio_Detection_and_Approximate_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_with_Multiple_Receiving_Antennas">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Mobile Networks and Applications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Shuo_Ma11" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/572510997409793-1513508666761_Q64/Shuo_Ma11.jpg" alt="Shuo Ma" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Shuo Ma</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Shuo_Ma11"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yanwen Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yanwen Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2136403635_Zhuyan_Zhao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhuyan Zhao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhuyan Zhao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2136403635_Zhuyan_Zhao"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Recently, ambient backscatter attracts much attention since it can utilize ambient radio frequency signals to enable battery-free devices to communicate with others. Most existing studies about ambient backscatter assume that the reader is equipped with one receiving antenna. In practice, the reader can utilize multiple antennas to overcome channel fading. In this paper, we investigate the problem of signal detection for ambient backscatter systems with multiple receiving antennas. Specifically, we formulate a new transmission model where the reader is equipped with at least two antennas and propose a ratio detector that exploits the ratio of the signal strength received at each antenna. It is shown that the closed-form expression of the optimal detection threshold for this detector is difficult to derive. Therefore, we derive a reasonable approximate expression for the optimal detection threshold. Moreover, we obtain the closed-form expression for approximate bit error rate (BER). Furthermore, we propose an antenna selection scheme if the reader is equipped with more than two antennas. The selection scheme is investigated through the BER performance. It is found that the largest gain in BER can be achieved when the antenna number increases from two to three, and that much less gain is obtained from enlarging the antenna number when the reader already has four antennas. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our theoretical studies.

http://rdcu.be/Bmsp</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Rate-Energy Tradeoff in Simultaneous Wireless Information and Power Transfer over Fading Channels with Uncertain Distribution"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-12-04"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" Tradeoff in Simultaneous Wireless Information and Power Transfer over Fading Channels with Uncertain Distribution</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/321505680_Rate-Energy_Tradeoff_in_Simultaneous_Wireless_Information_and_Power_Transfer_over_Fading_Channels_with_Uncertain_Distribution">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qi Gu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qi Gu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2068585078_Hai_Jiang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hai Jiang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hai Jiang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2068585078_Hai_Jiang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This Correspondence investigates the tradeoff between information rate and harvested energy in a simultaneous wireless information and power transfer system (SWIPT) under power splitting (PS) scheme and time switching (TS) scheme. A single-input-multiple-output (SIMO) transmitter-receiver pair is considered. For the channel from the transmitter to the receiver, only the mean and covariance matrix are known, but the instantaneous channel information or the channel gain distribution is unknown. We define robust outage capacity that applies for all possible channel distributions with the given mean and covariance matrix, and study the tradeoff between the robust outage capacity and harvested power level. By solving optimization problems, we find the PS ratio setting for PS scheme and TS ratio setting for TS scheme to achieve the outer boundary of robust outage capacity-energy region (which includes all possible pairs of achievable robust outage capacity and harvested power level). The PS and TS ratio setting are fixed over fading blocks, and thus, can avoid communication overhead and computation overhead over each fading block, and facilitate a simple implementation in a practical system. We also prove that the robust outage capacity-energy regions in PS scheme and TS scheme are both convex. Further, we prove that the PS scheme outperforms the TS scheme in terms of the rate-energy tradeoff. Numerical results are also presented to verify the correctness of our theoretical results.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">文晶 Zhao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/wenjing_Zhao15"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Saman_Atapattu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/277859013808134-1443258159945_Q64/Saman_Atapattu.jpg" alt="Saman Atapattu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Saman Atapattu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Saman_Atapattu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper addresses the problem of outage characterization of an ambient backscatter communication system with a pair of passive tag and reader. In particular, an exact expression for the effective channel distribution is derived. Then, the outage probability at the reader is analyzed rigorously. Since the expression contains an infinite sum, a tight truncation error bound has been derived to facilitate precise numerical evaluations. Furthermore, an asymptotic expression is provided for high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) regime.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Geometrical Based Modeling for Millimeter Wave MIMO Mobile-to-Mobile Channels"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-11-17"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/321143331_Geometrical_Based_Modeling_for_Millimeter_Wave_MIMO_Mobile-to-Mobile_Channels"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/321143331_Geometrical_Based_Modeling_for_Millimeter_Wave_MIMO_Mobile-to-Mobile_Channels" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Geometrical Based Modeling for Millimeter Wave MIMO Mobile-to-Mobile Channels</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/321143331_Geometrical_Based_Modeling_for_Millimeter_Wave_MIMO_Mobile-to-Mobile_Channels">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Ruisi_He" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ruisi He" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Ruisi He</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Ruisi_He"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/7342381_GL_Stuber" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="G.L. Stuber" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">G.L. Stuber</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/7342381_GL_Stuber"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2073420860_dui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="dui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">dui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2073420860_dui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">A geometric multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) channel model is proposed for millimeter-wave (mmWave) mobile-to-mobile (M2M) applications based on the two-ring reference model, where the cluster-based nonisotropic scattering at both ends of the radio link is considered. The proposed model employs a few clusters of scatterers located on the two rings centered on the transmitter and receiver, and intra-cluster azimuth spread of scatterers is further characterized according to mmWave channel characteristics. From the model, the time-frequency correlation function, power delay profile (PDP), and Doppler power spectrum are derived. By adjusting cluster number, cluster center position, and degree of intra-cluster nonisotropic scattering, the model is adaptable to a variety of M2M scenarios. Model validation is further conducted by comparing the simulated PDPs with mmWave outdoor measurements. Based on the detailed investigation of channel correlation functions, it is found that a small number of clusters lead to high channel correlation, and the degree of intra-cluster nonisotropic scattering has major impact on correlation only if cluster number is small. In addition, the Doppler power spectrum is similar to the U-shaped spectrum, and several factors (e.g., small cluster number, high intra-cluster azimuth spread, and large antenna spacing) introduce significant fluctuations in the spectrum. Finally, the model is implemented with directional antennas for safety related M2M scenarios, which leads to high channel correlation compared with using omnidirectional antennas. These observations and conclusions can be considered as a guidance for mmWave M2M MIMO system design.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2017</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2136736765_Xiong_Ke" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiong Ke" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiong Ke</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2136736765_Xiong_Ke"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2136773200_Ming_Liu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ming content="scientific-contributions/2136773200_Ming_Liu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2136762563_Zhong_Zhang-Dui" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhong Zhang-Dui" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhong Zhang-Dui</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2136762563_Zhong_Zhang-Dui"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">The origin of backscatter technology has been widely applied in logistics domain. One of the successful commercial applications of backscatter technology is electronic toll collection (ETC). Recently, with the extensive usage of Internet of Things (IoT), both academic world and industrial world proposes several new types of backscatter technologies for communications. The history of both IoT and backscatter was reviewed, the rising communication technologies of backscatter was concluded, their potential applications were predicted, and the coming challenges were analyzed, such as wireless energy harvesting, signal detection, multiple access, capacity bounds and security.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel capacity and lower bound for ambient backscatter communication systems"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-10-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/321734143_Channel_capacity_and_lower_bound_for_ambient_backscatter_communication_systems"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack Railways</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Aug 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Access</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Xiyu_Wang8" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiyu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiyu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Xiyu_Wang8"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper proposes a blind channel estimator based on expectation maximization (EM) algorithm and historical information based basis expansion model (HiBEM) for uplink wireless communication systems on high speed railways (HSRs). The information of basis matrices is obtained from the uplink data of the past trains at the base station (BS). With the known basis matrices at the BS, our suggested estimator can estimate the basis coefficients and recover the channel parameters without requiring training symbols. The modified Cramer Rao bound (MCRB) is derived for the estimated basis coefficients and the computational complexity of the proposed estimator is analysed. Numerical results are then provided to corroborate our studies. It is shown that the proposed estimator outperforms existing dataaided estimators, including least square (LS) and linear minimum mean square error (LMMSE).</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jul 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Access</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Xiaoyu_Zhou19" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/523064846426117-1501719785588_Q64/Xiaoyu_Zhou19.jpg" alt="Xiaoyu Zhou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiaoyu Zhou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Xiaoyu_Zhou19"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yanwen Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yanwen Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Julian_Cheng" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272795150057489-1442050840547_Q64/Julian_Cheng.jpg" alt="Julian Cheng" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Julian Cheng</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Julian_Cheng"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter is a new technology that uses ambient signals to enable communication between battery-free tags (or sensors) and readers. Previous studies on ambient backscatter focused on scenarios with only one tag. In this paper, we investigate the ambient backscatter communication system with multiple tags and analyze the performance of tag selection. Specifically, we formulate a tag selection scheme and design the corresponding detection method. Our results indicate that obtaining the closed-form bit-error rate (BER) in such cases is challenging; hence, we provide a solution for deriving an approximate BER. The simulation results show that the approximated BER curves are in agreement with the exact curves. OAPA</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Semi-coherent detector of ambient backscatter communication for the Internet of Things"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-07-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">VTC2017-Spring</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chen_Chen470" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Chen Chen" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chen Chen</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chen_Chen470"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yanwen Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yanwen Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2129143963_Quan_Miao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Quan Miao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Quan Miao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2129143963_Quan_Miao"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter is a new technology that utilizes existing wireless signals of other communication systems to enable small devices to communicate with each other. One key problem for ambient backscatter is that if it will result in interference on existing communication systems. We investigate this problem in this paper. Specifically, we build up the theoretical system model for the ambient backscatter systems, design a maximum likelihood (ML) detector for the legacy receiver, and also derive the corresponding bit error rate (BER) expressions. Finally, we evaluate the interference of the backscattered signals on existing communication systems via simulations. It is found that channel estimation results, distances and angles between the tag, the radio frequency (RF) source and the legacy receiver will impact the BER performance.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/317617145_Interference_Analysis_of_Ambient_Backscatter_on_Existing_Wireless_Communication_Systems">92 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div wireless information and power transfer over Rayleigh block fading channel"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-06-01"/><meta itemProp="image" TDD/FDD Massive MIMO Systems"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-05-01"/><meta itemProp="image" class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Angle Domain Signal Processing aided Channel Estimation for Indoor 60GHz TDD/FDD Massive MIMO Systems</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">May 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Dian_Fan2" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/280389370302493-1443861443722_Q64/Dian_Fan2.jpg" alt="Dian Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Dian Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Dian_Fan2"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Arumugam_Nallanathan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/456696570093570-1485896355512_Q64/Arumugam_Nallanathan.jpg" alt="Arumugam Nallanathan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Arumugam Nallanathan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Arumugam_Nallanathan"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper proposes a practical channel estimation for 60GHz indoor systems with the massive uniform rectangular array (URA) at base station (BS). Through antenna array theory, the parameters of each channel path can be decomposed into the angular information and the channel gain information. We first prove that the true direction of arrivals (DOAs) of each uplink path can be extracted via efficient array signal processing method. Then, the channel gain information could be obtained linearly with small amount of training resources, which significantly reduces the training overhead and the feedback cost. More importantly, the proposed scheme unifies the uplink/downlink channel estimations for both the time duplex division (TDD) and frequency duplex division (FDD) systems, making itself particularly suitable for protocol design. Compared to the existing channel estimation algorithms, the newly proposed one does not require any knowledge of channel statistics and can be efficiently deployed by the two dimensional fast Fourier transform (2D-FFT). Meanwhile, the number of user terminals (UTs) simultaneously served can be increased from a sophisticatedly designed angle division multiple access (ADMA) scheme. Simulation results are provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yang_Liu627"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhongzhao Dou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhongzhao Dou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter technology has attracted much attention recently because it enables battery-free devices, such as tags or sensors, to communicate through wireless energy harvesting and radio backscattering. Existing studies about ambient backscatter assume that the tags only have two states: backscatter or non-backscatter. Actually, some references have shown that the tags can readily realize three states: positive and negative phase backscatter, and non-backscatter. In this paper, we propose a new coding scheme for these tags with three states to improve the throughput of the ambient backscatter communication system. We then design a maximum a posteriori (MAP) detector for the reader to extract binary information from ternary coded signals. We also analyze the detection performance in term of closed-form bit error rate (BER) expressions. It is found that the proposed coding scheme can improve the throughput of ambient backscatter system and there exists an error floor for the BER curve. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/314298012_Coding_and_Detection_Schemes_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Network Utility Maximization in Wireless Networks Over Fading Channels With Uncertain Distribution"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2017-01-16"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/312483921_Network_Utility_Maximization_in_Wireless_Networks_Over_Fading_Channels_With_Uncertain_Distribution"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/312483921_Network_Utility_Maximization_in_Wireless_Networks_Over_Fading_Channels_With_Uncertain_Distribution" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Network Utility Maximization in Wireless Networks Over Fading Channels With Uncertain Distribution</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/312483921_Network_Utility_Maximization_in_Wireless_Networks_Over_Fading_Channels_With_Uncertain_Distribution">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2017</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Communications Letters</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2120691923_Song_Jin" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Song Jin" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Song Jin</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2120691923_Song_Jin"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/33113444_Xiangyuan_Bu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiangyuan Bu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiangyuan Bu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/33113444_Xiangyuan_Bu"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, the network utility maximization (NUM) problem is investigated for wireless networks when only channel mean and variance are known. Due to the randomness of wireless channel, link outage will happen and a traffic flow’s rate will gradually decrease along its routing path. When only channel mean and variance are known, channel distribution is uncertain and it is harder to control the rate loss caused by link outage. We take into account this feature of rate loss and target at maximizing the network utility of multiple traffic flows’ rates at their destinations. An optimization problem is formulated, which is non-convex. Global optimal solution is achieved with the aid of bilevel optimization method and monotonic optimization method. Numerical results are presented to verify the effectiveness of our proposed method.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Semi-coherent Detection and Performance Analysis for Ambient Backscatter System"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-12-23"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/311900750_Semi-coherent_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/311900750_Semi-coherent_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Semi-coherent Detection and Performance Analysis for Ambient Backscatter System</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/311900750_Semi-coherent_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Jing_Qian32" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jing Qian" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jing Qian</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Jing_Qian32"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12196355_Hongbo_Zhu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hongbo Zhu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hongbo Zhu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12196355_Hongbo_Zhu"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">We study a novel communication mechanism, ambient backscatter, that utilizes radio frequency (RF) signals transmitted from an ambient source as both energy supply and information carrier to enable communications between low-power devices. Different from existing non-coherent schemes, we here design the semi-coherent detection, where channel parameters can be obtained from unknown data symbols and a few pilot symbols. We first derive the optimal detector for the complex Gaussian ambient RF signal from likelihood ratio test and compute the corresponding closed-form bit error rate (BER). To release the requirement for prior knowledge of the ambient RF signal, we next design a suboptimal energy detector with ambient RF signals being either the complex Gaussian or the phase shift keying (PSK). The corresponding detection thresholds, the analytical BER, and the outage probability are also obtained in closed-form. Interestingly, the complex Gaussian source would cause an error floor while the PSK source does not, which brings nontrivial indication of constellation design as opposed to the popular Gaussian-embedded literatures. Simulations are provided to corroborate the theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/311900750_Semi-coherent_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list cognitive amplify-and-forward two-way relay networks"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-12-10"/><meta itemProp="image" class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/308583816_Joint_sensing_and_transmission_for_cognitive_amplify-and-forward_two-way_relay_networks" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Joint sensing and transmission for cognitive amplify-and-forward two-way relay networks</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/308583816_Joint_sensing_and_transmission_for_cognitive_amplify-and-forward_two-way_relay_networks">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2115769658_Zhen_Ma" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhen Ma" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhen Ma</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2115769658_Zhen_Ma"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou3" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/533351569735680-1504172331285_Q64/Yulong_Zou3.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou3"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2115759806_Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Bo Ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Bo Ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2115759806_Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we propose a cognitive transmission scheme for Amplify-and-Forward (AF) two-way relay networks (TWRNs) and investigate its joint sensing and transmission performance. Specifically, we derive the overall false alarm probability, the overall detection probability, the outage probability of the cognitive TWRN over Rayleigh fading channels. Furthermore, based on these probabilities, the spectrum hole utilization efficiency of the cognitive TWRN is defined and evaluated. It is shown that smaller individual or overall false alarm probability can result in less outage probability and thus larger spectrum hole utilization efficiency for cognitive TWRN, and however produce more interference to the primary users. Interestingly, it is found that given data rate, more transmission power for the cognitive TWRN does not necessarily obtain higher spectrum hole utilization efficiency. Moreover, our results show that a maximum spectrum hole utilization efficiency can be achieved through an optimal allocation of the time slots between the spectrum sensing and data transmission phases. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div
