Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Noncoherent Detections for Ambient Backscatter System"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-12-05"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/311443881_Noncoherent_Detections_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/311443881_Noncoherent_Detections_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Noncoherent Detections for Ambient Backscatter System</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/311443881_Noncoherent_Detections_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Jing_Qian32" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jing Qian" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jing Qian</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Jing_Qian32"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2058289734_Hong_Bo_Zhu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hong Bo Zhu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hong Bo Zhu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2058289734_Hong_Bo_Zhu"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter, an emerging communication mechanism where battery-free devices communicate with each other via backscattering ambient radio frequency (RF) signals, has achieved much attention recently because of its desirable application prospects in the Internet of Things (IoT). In this paper, we formulate a practical transmission model for an ambient backscatter system, where a tag wishes to send some lowrate messages to a reader with the help of an ambient RF signal source, and then provide fundamental studies of noncoherent symbol detection when all channel state information of the system is unknown. For the first time, a maximum likelihood detector is derived based on the joint probability density function of received signal vectors. In order to ease availability of prior knowledge of the ambient RF signal and reduce computational complexity of the algorithm, we design a joint-energy detector and derive its corresponding detection threshold. The analytical bit error rate (BER) and BER-based outage probability are also obtained in closed-form, which helps with designing system parameters. An estimation method to obtain detection-required parameters and comparison of computational complexity of the detectors are presented as complementary discussions. Simulation results are provided to corroborate theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/311443881_Noncoherent_Detections_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/311443881_Noncoherent_Detections_for_Ambient_Backscatter_System">16 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems: Detection and Performance Analysis"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-11-28"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/308890346_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis/links/5a6422a1a6fdccb61c54cdb9/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/308890346_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/308890346_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems: Detection and Performance Analysis</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green href="publication/308890346_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems_Detection_and_Performance_Analysis">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter technology that utilizes the
ambient radio frequency (RF) signals to enable the communications
of battery-free devices has attracted much attention
recently. In this paper, we study the problem of signal detection
for an ambient backscatter communication system that adopts
the differential encoding to eliminate the necessity of channel
estimation. Specifically, we formulate a new transmission model,
design the data detection algorithm, and derive two closed-form
detection thresholds. One threshold is used to approximately
achieve the minimum sum bit error rate (BER) while the other
yields balanced error probabilities for “0” bit and “1” bits. The
corresponding BER expressions are derived to fully characterize
the detection performance. In addition, the lower and the upper
bounds of BER at high signal noise ratio (SNR) regions are also
examined to simplify performance analysis. Simulation results
are then provided to corroborate the theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Wireless relay communication on high speed railway: Full duplex or half duplex?"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-11-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/311637359_Wireless_relay_communication_on_high_speed_railway_Full_duplex_or_half_duplex"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/311637359_Wireless_relay_communication_on_high_speed_railway_Full_duplex_or_half_duplex" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Wireless relay communication on high speed railway: Full duplex or half duplex?</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/311637359_Wireless_relay_communication_on_high_speed_railway_Full_duplex_or_half_duplex">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Wireless Communication over ZigBee for Automotive Inclination Measurement. China Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia You" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia You</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhongzhao Dou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhongzhao Dou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we introduce one full-duplex (FD) relaying transmission scheme for high speed railway and compare its ergodic capacity and outage performance with half-duplex (HD) relaying scheme. Both decode-and-forward (DF) amplify-and-forward (AF) relay modes are considered. Moreover, the carriage penetration loss (CPL) and the self-interference (SI) cancellation ratio are investigated. We derive the closed-form expressions for the outage probability and ergodic capacity of both HD and FD relay transmission schemes. It is shown that when CPL is larger than a certain level, the FD relay can achieve better performance in terms of capacity and keep the outage probability in a low level. It is also found that three factors: AF or DF modes, CPL and SI cancellation ratio, can have impact on capacity performance, and that CPL is one decisive factor. Our results can provide theoretical supports for development and deployment of future wireless communication systems on high speed railways.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Spectrum Sensing and Throughput Analysis for Cognitive Two-Way Relay Networks With Multiple Transmit Powers"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-10-04"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/309082180_Spectrum_Sensing_and_Throughput_Analysis_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_With_Multiple_Transmit_Powers/links/5a902ea00f7e9ba4296b7b15/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/309082180_Spectrum_Sensing_and_Throughput_Analysis_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_With_Multiple_Transmit_Powers"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/309082180_Spectrum_Sensing_and_Throughput_Analysis_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_With_Multiple_Transmit_Powers" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Spectrum Sensing and Throughput Analysis for Cognitive Two-Way Relay Networks With Multiple Transmit Powers</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/309082180_Spectrum_Sensing_and_Throughput_Analysis_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_With_Multiple_Transmit_Powers">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/309082180_Spectrum_Sensing_and_Throughput_Analysis_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_With_Multiple_Transmit_Powers">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Oct 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yang_Liu627" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yang Liu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yang_Liu627"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span href="" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ming Xiao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Ming Xiao</span><span></span></span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Existing studies on cognitive two-way relay networks (TWRNs) assume that the primary users (PUs) transmit data with two power levels. In practice, it is possible that the PUs may adopt multiple power levels to maximize their throughputs or to compensate for wireless link fading. In such a scenario, there exist two key problems: one is the detection accuracy for the secondary users (SUs), and the other is the throughput tradeoff between PUs and SUs. To address the detection accuracy challenge, we propose a cooperative soft-combination-based energy detector and demonstrate its benefit over other hard-combination-based detectors. To solve the throughput tradeoff problem, we derive the throughput expressions for both PUs and SUs and analyze the impact of our detection accuracy on the throughputs. It is shown that the SU’s throughput varies with the number of the PU’s transmit power levels and achieves a maximum value when the number is small. We also find that increasing the detection capability of the SU reduces its own throughput, while increases the PU’s throughput.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center itemProp="headline" content="Robust Power and Bandwidth Allocation in Cognitive Radio System With Uncertain Distributional Interference Channels"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Oct 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2113530295_Wen_Chen" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Wen Chen" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Wen Chen</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2113530295_Wen_Chen"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/14081297_Jianping_An" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jianping An" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jianping An</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/14081297_Jianping_An"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, the problem of joint transmit power and bandwidth allocation over multiple channels is investigated for a secondary user in underlay mode, when partial information of interference channel is known. The target is to maximize the capacity of a secondary user under a probabilistic constraint of the interference to the primary user. A robust optimization problem is formulated, which is nondeterministic and cannot be solved directly. We then transform the original optimization problem into an equivalent convex optimization problem. For general case, an optimal solving algorithm, which is a combination of analytical and bisection-search methods, is given. For some special cases, simple and optimal solving algorithms are also devised. Numerical results are presented to show that our proposed optimal algorithm has low computation complexity when the number of channels is not large and can achieve global optimal utility in general case and our proposed simple algorithms have much lower computation complexity and can achieve global optimal utility in special cases.</div></div></div></div><footer itemProp="headline" content="Statistical Covariance Based Signal Detection for Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-09-18"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/305702530_Statistical_Covariance_Based_Signal_Detection_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Statistical Covariance Based Signal Detection for Ambient Backscatter Communication Systems</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">2016 IEEE 84th Vehicular Technology Conference: VTC2016-Fall</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Tengchan_Zeng" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/389014747140096-1469759751205_Q64/Tengchan_Zeng.jpg" alt="Tengchan Zeng" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Tengchan Zeng</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Tengchan_Zeng"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yanwen Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yanwen Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2113297246_Yanwen_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter, a new communication technology , can permit battery-free devices to communicate with other devices through reflecting the ambient radio frequency signals. One challenge for ambient backscatter communication system is to recover the backscattered information bits hidden in the received signals. Existing solutions are mainly based on energy detector and thus provide poor performance at low signal noise ratio (SNR). To solve this problem, a detection algorithm based on statistical covariances is suggested in this paper. Specifically, we calculate the distributions of two covariance-based statistics, design the detection rule, and then derive the closed-form expressions for detection probability and bit error rate (BER). It is found that our proposed algorithm outperforms the energy detector at low SNR regions. Finally, the simulation results are provided to corroborate our theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Claude_Oestges" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/548243081183232-1507722744179_Q64/Claude_Oestges.jpg" alt="Claude Oestges" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Claude Oestges</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Claude_Oestges"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">High-speed railways (HSRs) improve the quality of rail services, yield greater customer satisfaction, and help to create socioeconomically balanced societies [1]. This highly efficient transport mode creates significant challenges in terms of investment, technology, industry, and environment. To handle increasing traffic, ensure passenger safety, and provide real-time multimedia information, a new communication system for HSR is required. In the last decade, public networks have been evolving from voice-centric second-generation systems, e.g., Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) with limited capabilities, to fourth-generation (4G) broad-band systems that offer higher data rates, e.g., long-term evolution (LTE). It is thus relevant for HSR to replace the current GSM-railway (GSM-R) technology with the next-generation railway-dedicated communication system providing improved capacity and capability.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/307518255_High-Speed_Railway_Communications_From_GSM-R_to_LTE-R"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel Estimation with New Basis Expansion Model for Wireless Communications on High Speed Railways"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-05-15"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/319165895_Channel_Estimation_with_New_Basis_Expansion_Model_for_Wireless_Communications_on_High_Speed_Railways/links/599931e20f7e9b3edb17006f/preview.png"/><meta class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/319165895_Channel_Estimation_with_New_Basis_Expansion_Model_for_Wireless_Communications_on_High_Speed_Railways" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Channel Estimation with New Basis Expansion Model for Wireless Communications on High Speed Railways</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/319165895_Channel_Estimation_with_New_Basis_Expansion_Model_for_Wireless_Communications_on_High_Speed_Railways">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">May 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">2016 IEEE 83rd Vehicular Technology Conference (VTC Spring)</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Xiyu_Wang8" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiyu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiyu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Xiyu_Wang8"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou3" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/533351569735680-1504172331285_Q64/Yulong_Zou3.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou3"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2131879742_Beijing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="★ Beijing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">★ Beijing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2131879742_Beijing"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Time-varying channel estimation is a well-known challenge for wireless communications on high-speed railways. Existing estimation algorithms include interpolation, basis expansion model (BEM) and autoregressive models. These methods remain unchanged for every scenario on high speed railways (HSRs), such as viaducts, tunnels, cutting and open areas. Thus their estimation performance are not consistent and also not satisfactory in many cases. Noting that every train on one high-speed railway follows the same track and therefore the channel parameters are correlated at each fixed position. Based on this observation, we propose a new BEM that explores the correlation between current channels parameters and past ones. More importantly, we analyze its channel estimation performance and justify our suggestions. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies. Index terms— Channel estimation, time-varying channel, basis expansion model, high speed railways.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Efficient spectrum sensing and power allocation for cognitive two-way relay network"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2016-03-21"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/299354922_Efficient_spectrum_sensing_and_power_allocation_for_cognitive_two-way_relay_network">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Mar 2016</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IET Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qi Gu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qi Gu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this study, a problem of efficient spectrum sensing and power allocation is studied. A network of cognitive radio adopting the technique of two-way relay is considered. A relay node, sitting between two secondary users, carries out spectrum sensing and helps the two secondary users to realise bidirectional relay communications. For such a system, an optimisation problem which targets at maximising the average rate between the two secondary users while guaranteeing the detection probability above a predefined threshold, is formulated. Although the problem is shown to be non-convex which means the global optimal solution is hard to be obtained, the authors solve the formulated problem global optimally by using a combination of bilevel optimisation and monotonic programming. Numerical results are provided to present the effectiveness of the authors&#x27; proposed algorithm.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/281209719_Uplink_Detection_and_BER_Analysis_for_Ambient_Backscatter_Communication_Systems"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2015</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Globecom 2015</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhongzhao Dou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhongzhao Dou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2079918373_Zhongzhao_Dou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter is a new communication technology that utilizes ambient radio frequency signals to enable battery-free devices to communicate with each other. In this paper, we study the problem of signal detection and bit error rate (BER) performance for this new communication system where the differential encoding is adopted to eliminate the necessity of channel estimation. We formulate a new transmission model, design the data detection approach, and derive the optimal/approximate closed-form detection thresholds. In addition, the performance at high signal-to-noise region (SNR) is also analyzed, where the lower and the upper bounds of BERs are found. Simulation results are then provided to corroborate our theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Green Circuit Design for Battery-Free Sensors in Cloud Radio Access Network"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2015-11-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/288178494_Green_Circuit_Design_for_Battery-Free_Sensors_in_Cloud_Radio_Access_Network"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/288178494_Green_Circuit_Design_for_Battery-Free_Sensors_in_Cloud_Radio_Access_Network" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Green Circuit Design for Battery-Free Sensors in Cloud Radio Access Network</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/288178494_Green_Circuit_Design_for_Battery-Free_Sensors_in_Cloud_Radio_Access_Network">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2015</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Wireless Communication over ZigBee for Automotive Inclination Measurement. China Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Tengchan_Zeng" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/389014747140096-1469759751205_Q64/Tengchan_Zeng.jpg" alt="Tengchan Zeng" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Tengchan Zeng</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Tengchan_Zeng"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/11508820_Zhong_Zhangdui" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhong Zhangdui" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhong Zhangdui</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/11508820_Zhong_Zhangdui"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Cloud radio access network (C-RAN) is considered as a promising approach to solve the bandwidth crunch problem for future wireless network. Another important element for future network is sensors that can monitor physical or environmental conditions. Currently, most sensors need batteries for power, which is energy-consuming and maintenance-heavy. To further improve energy efficiency (EE) of sensors in C-RAN, this paper proposes a new structure as well as practical circuit design for green sensors in C-RAN. The structure can enable sensors to harvest energy from radio signals transmitted by neighbor remote radio heads (RRHs) and user terminals (UTs). To demonstrate the validity of the new structure, a practical circuit design is suggested and the corresponding hardware platform is realized. Specifically, selection criteria for electrical component parameters and design of an impedance-matching network are discussed in details. In addition, two methods to stabilize the output voltage are proposed and analyzed. Finally, simulation results as well as experimental results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list content="profile/Tengchan_Zeng"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter &quot; is a new communication technology that utilizes ambient radio frequency signals to enable battery-free devices to communicate with each other. In this paper, we formulate a new transmission model when the reader is equipped with multiple antennas and propose a new way for signal detection when the channel state information is unknown. We derive an approximate closed-form detection threshold to identify the transmitted symbols and also analyze the corresponding bit error rate (BER) performance. It is found that increasing number of receiving antennas will lead to lower BER, while there exists an error floor when the antenna number is above certain level. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our theoretical studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2077606068_Qiang_Liu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qiang Liu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qiang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2077606068_Qiang_Liu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Ruisi_He" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ruisi He" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Ruisi He</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Ruisi_He"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">As an emerging system architecture, heterogeneous cloud radio access networks (H-CRANs) can improve system capacity, enlarge coverage, and enhance energy/spectral efficiency. Meanwhile, this newborn architecture also brings many open problems for traditional topics, including synchronization, channel estimation, and data detection. In this article, we present a comprehensive analysis on obtaining CSI in H-CRANs. Specifically, we recognize seven challenges in channel estimation that are caused by a large number of channel parameters, heterogeneity of access nodes in H-CRANs, and the time delays among different nodes. Several research directions for handling these challenges are also proposed, for example, array signal processing and channel compression can eliminate the number of channel estimates, while channel prediction and modification for high-speed railway communications and adaptive downlink array from uplink measurements excel in overcoming the non-reciprocity in channel parameters.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m
