Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Investing and Pricing with Supply Uncertainty in Electricity Market: a General View Combining Wholesale and Retail Market"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2015-03-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market/links/5819da8608ae30a2c01c6ed5/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Investing and Pricing with Supply Uncertainty in Electricity Market: a General View Combining Wholesale and Retail Market</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Mar 2015</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Wireless Communication over ZigBee for Automotive Inclination Measurement. China Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2064971624_Xiaobo_Li" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiaobo Li" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiaobo Li</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2064971624_Xiaobo_Li"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2055639130_Li_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Li Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Li Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2055639130_Li_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2071991788_Qingwei_Wu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qingwei Wu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qingwei Wu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2071991788_Qingwei_Wu"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Renewable energy, such as wind and solar energy, may vary significantly over time and locations depending on the weather and the climate conditions. This leads to the supply uncertainty in the electricity (power) market with renewable energy integrated to power grid. In this paper, electricity in the market is classified into two types: stable-supply electricity (SSE) and unstable-supply electricity (USE). We investigate the investment and pricing strategies under the electricity supply uncertainty in wholesale and retail electricity market. In particular, our model combines the wholesale and retail market and capture the dominant players, i.e., consumers, power plant (power operator), and electricity supplier. To derive the market behaviors of these players, we formulate the market decision problems as a multistage Stackelberg game. By solving the game model, we obtain the optimal, with closed-form, wholesale investment and retail pricing strategy for the operator. We also obtain the energy supplier&#x27;s best price mechanism numerically under certain assumption. We find the price of SSE being about 1.4 times higher than that of USE will benefit energy supplier optimally, under which power plant&#x27;s optimal strategy of investing is to purchase USE about 4.5 times much more than SSE.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/275254951_Investing_and_Pricing_with_Supply_Uncertainty_in_Electricity_Market_a_General_View_Combining_Wholesale_and_Retail_Market"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Intercept Behavior Analysis of Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks in the Presence of Eavesdropping Attack"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2015-01-31"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/271771661_Intercept_Behavior_Analysis_of_Industrial_Wireless_Sensor_Networks_in_the_Presence_of_Eavesdropping_Attack/links/54e7335f0cf2b1990609cfd2/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/271771661_Intercept_Behavior_Analysis_of_Industrial_Wireless_Sensor_Networks_in_the_Presence_of_Eavesdropping_Attack"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/271771661_Intercept_Behavior_Analysis_of_Industrial_Wireless_Sensor_Networks_in_the_Presence_of_Eavesdropping_Attack" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Intercept Behavior Analysis of Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks in the Presence of Eavesdropping Attack</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/271771661_Intercept_Behavior_Analysis_of_Industrial_Wireless_Sensor_Networks_in_the_Presence_of_Eavesdropping_Attack">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/271771661_Intercept_Behavior_Analysis_of_Industrial_Wireless_Sensor_Networks_in_the_Presence_of_Eavesdropping_Attack">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2015</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper studies the intercept behavior of an industrial wireless sensor
network (WSN) consisting of a sink node and multiple sensors in the presence of
an eavesdropping attacker, where the sensors transmit their sensed information
to the sink node through wireless links. Due to the broadcast nature of radio
wave propagation, the wireless transmission from the sensors to the sink can be
readily overheard by the eavesdropper for interception purposes. In an
information-theoretic sense, the secrecy capacity of the wireless transmission
is the difference between the channel capacity of the main link (from sensor to
sink) and that of the wiretap link (from sensor to eavesdropper). If the
secrecy capacity becomes non-positive due to the wireless fading effect, the
sensor&#x27;s data transmission could be successfully intercepted by the
eavesdropper and an intercept event occurs in this case. However, in industrial
environments, the presence of machinery obstacles, metallic frictions and
engine vibrations makes the wireless fading fluctuate drastically, resulting in
the degradation of the secrecy capacity. As a consequence, an optimal sensor
scheduling scheme is proposed in this paper to protect the legitimate wireless
transmission against the eavesdropping attack, where a sensor with the highest
secrecy capacity is scheduled to transmit its sensed information to the sink.
Closed-form expressions of the probability of occurrence of an intercept event
(called intercept probability) are derived for the conventional round-robin
scheduling and the proposed optimal scheduling schemes. Also, an asymptotic
intercept probability analysis is conducted to provide an insight into the
impact of the sensor scheduling on the wireless security. Numerical results
demonstrate that the proposed sensor scheduling scheme outperforms the
conventional round-robin scheduling in terms of the intercept probability.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="On Secrecy Performance of Antenna Selection Aided MIMO Systems Against Eavesdropping"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2015-01-26"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/271448020_On_Secrecy_Performance_of_Antenna_Selection_Aided_MIMO_Systems_Against_Eavesdropping/links/54e7335f0cf2cd2e029194fb/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/271448020_On_Secrecy_Performance_of_Antenna_Selection_Aided_MIMO_Systems_Against_Eavesdropping"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/271448020_On_Secrecy_Performance_of_Antenna_Selection_Aided_MIMO_Systems_Against_Eavesdropping" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">On Secrecy Performance of Antenna Selection Aided MIMO Systems Against Eavesdropping</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2015</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/46351760_Jia_Zhu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia Zhu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia Zhu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/46351760_Jia_Zhu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/George_Karagiannidis" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/426146702598144-1478612699602_Q64/George_Karagiannidis.jpg" alt="George K. Karagiannidis" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">George K. Karagiannidis</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/George_Karagiannidis"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we consider a multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) system
consisting of one source, one destination and one eavesdropper, where each node
is equipped with an arbitrary number of antennas. To improve the security of
source-destination transmissions, we investigate the antenna selection at the
source and propose the optimal antenna selection (OAS) and suboptimal antenna
selection (SAS) schemes, depending on whether the source node has the global
channel state information (CSI) of both the main link (from source to
destination) and wiretap link (from source to eavesdropper). Also, the
traditional space-time transmission (STT) is studied as a benchmark. We
evaluate the secrecy performance of STT, SAS, and OAS schemes in terms of the
probability of zero secrecy capacity. Furthermore, we examine the generalized
secrecy diversity of STT, SAS, and OAS schemes through an asymptotic analysis
of the probability of zero secrecy capacity, as the ratio between the average
gains of the main and wiretap channels tends to infinity. This is different
from the conventional secrecy diversity which assumes an infinite
signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) received at the destination under the condition
that the eavesdropper has a finite received SNR. It is shown that the
generalized secrecy diversity orders of STT, SAS, and OAS schemes are the
product of the number of antennas at source and destination. Additionally,
numerical results show that the proposed OAS scheme strictly outperforms both
the STT and SAS schemes in terms of the probability of zero secrecy capacity.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/283883342_Security-Reliability_Analysis_for_Cloud_Radio_Networks_with_Channel_Estimation_Error"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Security-Reliability Analysis for Cloud Radio Networks with Channel Estimation Error</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2015</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia You" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia You</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">n this paper, we introduce a three-phase transmis- sion scheme for cloud radio networks against eavesdropper. We study the security and reliability performance of this scheme in the form of intercept probability and outage probability, respectively. Channel estimation error is considered in our study instead of assumption of perfect channel state information. It is found that the security-reliability performance improves as the number of relay increases. Moreover, the length of training symbol considerably influences the performance. Simulation results are provided to corroborate our studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div cognitive two-way relay system with an eavesdropper"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2015-01-12"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/282680750_Secure_performance_analysis_of_cognitive_two-way_relay_system_with_an_eavesdropper/links/5818c05008ae50812f5dce6d/preview.png"/><meta performance analysis of cognitive two-way relay system with an eavesdropper</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2015</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qi Gu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongfei_Fan" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/499685527494657-1496145721286_Q64/Rongfei_Fan.jpg" alt="Rongfei Fan" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongfei Fan</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongfei_Fan"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper investigates the system performance of two-way relay channel with an eavesdropper in cognitive network, where two users exchange their information via an assisting relay based on the detection results of the primary users. Specifically, when the two-way relay system detects that the primary users do not occupy the spectrum, they will perform the two-way transmission. Otherwise, they will keep silent. Besides, an eavesdropper tries its best to overhear the information from the two-way transmission. For such a system, its performance in terms of the intercept probability is derived over Rayleigh fading channels. Numerical results are provided to show the intercept performance of the system versus the system transmission power and data rate threshold.</div></div></div></div><footer available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2015</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yang_Liu627" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yang Liu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yang_Liu627"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2080158400_Dan_Hu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Dan Hu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Dan Hu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2080158400_Dan_Hu"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, cyclostationary detection Based spectrum sensing is considered for cognitive radio networks. We first summarize the existing first-order and second-order cyclostationary detection algorithms, which can be considered as a brief tutorial on detection theory of the cyclostationary signals. Based on this, we propose a cooperative spectrum sensing method for a cognitive radio networks with multiple terminals and one fusion center. It is shown that the proposed method have reliable performance even in low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) region. It is also found that the increasing number of secondary users (SUs) can result in improved detection performance, especially at low SNR. Simulation results are then provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Ambient backscatter is a new communication technology that utilizes ambient radio frequency signals of other systems to enable battery-free devices, such as tags and sensors, to communicate with each other. This paper investigates the physical layer security problem for ambient backscatter communication systems with multiple tags/sensors. Specifically, a new protocol is suggested to facilitate communication process and enhance the security of data transmission between the multiple tags and the reader. This protocol can lead to much lower bit error rate (BER) for the uplink from the tags to the reader, and meanwhile maintain almost the same BER for the wiretap link from the tags to the eavesdropper. We also propose detection approaches and derive closed-form detection thresholds for the reader and the eavesdropper. It is shown that increasing number of tags can lower BER at the reader receiver. It is also found that the number of tags and the number of training symbols can be optimized to maximize data rate gap between the reader and the the eavesdropper. Interestingly, it is found that the maximum data rate gap, a measure for secrecy capacity, is not obtained at high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). Simulation results are then provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/289745594_Spectrum_Sensing_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_with_Multiple_Primary_Transmit_Powers" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Spectrum Sensing for Cognitive Two-Way Relay Networks with Multiple Primary Transmit Powers</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/289745594_Spectrum_Sensing_for_Cognitive_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_with_Multiple_Primary_Transmit_Powers">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2014</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yang_Liu627" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yang Liu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yang_Liu627"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2093025994_Qian_Zhang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qian Zhang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qian Zhang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2093025994_Qian_Zhang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we study the cognitive radio networks where the primary users transmit data with multiple power levels. A cooperative sensing algorithm with soft combination based on energy detection is proposed to improve the detection accuracy. We compare the detection performance between our proposed cooperative soft combination and existing hard combination, such as averaging combination, maximum combination and minimum combination. It is found that the suggested algorithm outperforms other existing hard combination schemes. It is also shown that the increasing number of the cooperative users can result in better detection performance at low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), while will obtain limited contribution for detection in high SNR. In the end, we validate our work by various simulation results.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Security-reliability performance of cognitive AF relay-based wireless communication system with channel estimation error Security Challenges and Issues in Cognitive Radio Networks"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-11-30"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks/links/56938c4808ae0f920dce8ef1/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Security-reliability performance of cognitive AF relay-based wireless communication system with channel estimation error Security Challenges and Issues in Cognitive Radio Networks</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Journal on Advances in Signal Processing</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Qi Gu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Qi Gu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2082520904_Qi_Gu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2055639130_Li_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Li Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Li Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2055639130_Li_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Mugen_Peng" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/285750097661952-1445139540290_Q64/Mugen_Peng.jpg" alt="Mugen Peng" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Mugen Peng</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Mugen_Peng"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, both the security and the reliability performance of the cognitive amplify-and-forward (AF) relay system are analyzed in the presence of the channel estimation error. The security and the reliability performance are represented by the outage probability and the intercept probability, respectively. Instead of perfect channel state information (CSI) predominantly assumed in the literature, a certain channel estimation algorithm and the influence of the corresponding channel estimation error are considered in this study. Specifically, linear minimum mean square error estimation (LMMSE) is utilized by the destination node and the eavesdropper node to obtain the CSI, and the closed form for the outage probability and that for the intercept probability are derived with the channel estimation error. It is shown that the transmission security (reliability) can be improved by loosening the reliability (security) requirement. Moreover, we compare the security and reliability performance of this relay-based cognitive radio system with those of the direct communication system without relay. Interestingly, it is found that the AF relay-based system has less reliability performance than the direct cognitive radio system; however, it can lower the sum of the outage probability and the intercept probability than the direct communication system. It is also found that there exists an optimal training number to minimize the sum of the outage probability and the intercept probability.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/262001367_Security-reliability_performance_of_cognitive_AF_relay-based_wireless_communication_system_with_channel_estimation_error_Security_Challenges_and_Issues_in_Cognitive_Radio_Networks">30 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Secrecy Outage Probability Analysis of Multi-User Multi-Eavesdropper Wireless Systems"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-11-02"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/267759923_Secrecy_Outage_Probability_Analysis_of_Multi-User_Multi-Eavesdropper_Wireless_Systems/links/54e733600cf277664ff80a50/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/267759923_Secrecy_Outage_Probability_Analysis_of_Multi-User_Multi-Eavesdropper_Wireless_Systems"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/267759923_Secrecy_Outage_Probability_Analysis_of_Multi-User_Multi-Eavesdropper_Wireless_Systems" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Secrecy Outage Probability Analysis of Multi-User Multi-Eavesdropper Wireless Systems</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/267759923_Secrecy_Outage_Probability_Analysis_of_Multi-User_Multi-Eavesdropper_Wireless_Systems">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2014</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou3" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/533351569735680-1504172331285_Q64/Yulong_Zou3.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou3"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/46351760_Jia_Zhu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia Zhu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia Zhu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/46351760_Jia_Zhu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2057503968_Hua_Shao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hua Shao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hua Shao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2057503968_Hua_Shao"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we explore the physical-layer security of a multi-user
wireless system that consists of multiple users intending to transmit to a base
station (BS), while multiple eavesdroppers attempt to tap the user
transmissions. We examine the employment of multi-user scheduling for improving
the transmission security against eavesdropping and propose a multi-user
scheduling scheme, which only requires the channel state information (CSI) of
BS without the need of the passive eavesdroppers&#x27; CSI. We also consider the
round-robin scheduling for comparison purposes. The closed-form secrecy outage
probability expressions of the round-robin scheduling and proposed multi-user
scheduling are derived over Rayleigh fading channels. Numerical results
demonstrate that the proposed multi-user scheduling outperforms the round-robin
scheduling in terms of the secrecy outage probability. As the number of users
increases, the secrecy outage probability of round-robin scheduling keeps
unchanged. By contrast, the secrecy outage performance of the proposed
multi-user scheduling improves significantly with an increasing number of
users.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">The utilization of the spectrum surrounding 60GHz can be a promising technology for wireless communication systems. This paper investigates the channel estimation problem for wireless systems at 60GHz frequency band with massive receiving antennas. The system model is built up over the massive frequency-selective channels. Moreover, an algorithm is proposed to estimate the large number of channel parameters. It is found that the suggested algorithm works well and can obtain all channel parameters without transmitting large number of training symbols. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div scheme in networks with the locator/identifier separation"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-10-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/264691859_A_distributed_mobility_management_scheme_in_networks_with_the_locatoridentifier_separation"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/264691859_A_distributed_mobility_management_scheme_in_networks_with_the_locatoridentifier_separation" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">A distributed mobility management scheme in networks with the locator/identifier separation</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/264691859_A_distributed_mobility_management_scheme_in_networks_with_the_locatoridentifier_separation">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Oct 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">International Journal of Communication Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/74496768_Feng_Qiu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feng Qiu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feng Qiu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/74496768_Feng_Qiu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/69661284_Huachun_Zhou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Huachun Zhou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Huachun Zhou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/69661284_Huachun_Zhou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2013990439_Xiaoqian_Li" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xiaoqian Li" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiaoqian Li</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2013990439_Xiaoqian_Li"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Hongke_Zhang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hongke Zhang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hongke Zhang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Hongke_Zhang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">SUMMARY In traditional Internet architectures, current centralized mobility management schemes face scalability issues because of the creation of network bottlenecks and a single mobility agent of failures. To address these issues, we propose a distributed mobility management scheme in locator/identifier separation networks (DMMLIS). We divide the network into many domains according to the area of autonomous systems. Each domain consists of a mapping server and several tunnel routers (xTRs). The mapping server stores global mappings between endpoint identifier (EID) prefixes and autonomous system numbers (ASNs) to lookup the mobile nodes&#x27; (MNs&#x27;) home domain. Meanwhile, the mapping server also contains ASN-to-xTR mappings so that it can forward Map-Register and Map-Request messages to any xTR of the MN&#x27;s home domain, thus enhancing reliability. In addition, the xTRs in each domain constitute one-hop distributed hash table ring. Moreover, any xTR in the MN&#x27;s home domain may be the home agent of MNs, and the MNs&#x27; EID-to-RLOC (routing locator) mapping is stored in two xTRs using two hash functions. In this way, it not only supports quick lookup but also improves scalability and survivability. To evaluate the survivability and the efficiency of DMMLIS, we analyze the service blocking probability, the system response time, and the total protocol cost. We also present numerical results to demonstrate the performance of the proposed scheme. Copyright © 2012 John Wiley &amp; Sons, Ltd.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Network coding is a beautiful and powerful technique whose emergence invokes a wide range of applications. Along with the development of the theoretical research and wide-spread applications, just like its original butterfly network topology, network coding metamorphoses from a complex and abstruse theory to a widely accepted and natural choice for wireless designs. The mystery and nature behind network coding become more and more attractive and important for wireless researchers. In this very first chapter, we briefly review network coding theory. Specifically, the physical layer network coding (PLNC) is discussed in more detail and understood from three different viewpoints. This way reveals the relationships among PLNC and several existing transmission schemes, which are helpful for us to exploit the performance advantages promised by PLNC.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Conclusions and Future Research Directions"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-09-16"/><meta itemProp="image"
