content="publication/301951208_Conclusions_and_Future_Research_Directions"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/301951208_Conclusions_and_Future_Research_Directions" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Conclusions and Future Research Directions</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/301951208_Conclusions_and_Future_Research_Directions">Chapter</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/301951208_Conclusions_and_Future_Research_Directions">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this book, we have discussed channel estimation for various situations in PLNC, including frequency flat fading environment, frequency selective fading environment, and time-selective fading environment. In each environment, we demonstrated how the channel estimation is different from the conventional point-to-point transmission as well as from the uni-directional relay network. The key idea is that the individual channel knowledge should be obtained at three nodes, i.e., the terminals and the relay, within one round of the data exchange. One may, of course, apply more complicated training process, say, training each channel link separately and share the information through feedback channels but such processing is not compatible with the overall structure of the data frame. Moreover, we developed channel estimation algorithms that fit the speciality of different environments, for example in frequency selective fading environment it is possible to remove the redundant estimates so that the overall training length could be reduced, while in time selective fading environment the individual BEM coefficient is estimated instead of the channel parameters.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel Estimation for PLNC Under Frequency Flat Fading Scenario"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-09-16"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario/links/5819e3c408aed24393869c76/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Channel Estimation for PLNC Under Frequency Flat Fading Scenario</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario">Chapter</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this chapter, we consider channel estimation for PLNC system in a frequency flat fading scenario. We propose a two-phase training protocol for channel estimation that can be easily embedded into the two-phase data transmission. Each terminal targets at estimating the individual channel parameters. We first derive the maximum-likelihood (ML) estimator, which is nonlinear and differs much from the conventional least-square (LS) estimator. Due to the difficulty in obtaining a closed-form expression of the mean square error (MSE) for the ML estimator, we resort to the Cramér-Rao lower bound (CRLB) of the estimation MSE to design the optimal training sequence. In the mean time, we introduce a new type of estimator that aims at maximizing the effective receive signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) after taking into consideration the channel estimation errors, referred to as the linear maximum signal-to-noise ratio (LMSNR) estimator. Furthermore, we prove that orthogonal training design is optimal for both the CRLB- and the LMSNR-based design criteria. Finally, simulations are presented to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/301951257_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Flat_Fading_Scenario">5 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel Estimation for PLNC Under Frequency Selective Fading Scenario"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-09-16"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/301951336_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Selective_Fading_Scenario/links/5819e3b408ae30a2c01c8a7b/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/301951336_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Selective_Fading_Scenario"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link for PLNC Under Frequency Selective Fading Scenario</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green href="publication/301951336_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Selective_Fading_Scenario">Chapter</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/301951336_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Frequency_Selective_Fading_Scenario">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this chapter, we consider the channel estimation for PLNC under the more general frequency selective scenario, where orthogonal-frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM) is adopted for data transmission. We propose a two-phase training protocol, which is compatible with the two-phase data transmission, and thus the training block can be embedded into the data frame. Specifically, we design two different types of training methods: (i) block based training, for which we first estimate the cascaded source-relay-source channels, and then recover the individual channels between sources and relay; (ii) pilot-tone (PT) based training, for which we directly estimate the individual channels between sources and relay. Importantly, the identifiability of the channel estimation in both types of the training schemes are fully addressed. Finally, various numerical examples are presented to corroborate our analytical results.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Background on Channel Estimation"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-09-16"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation/links/5819e3d508aeffb2941303ba/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Background on Channel Estimation</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation">Chapter</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this chapter, we introduce popular channel estimation approaches in the conventional point-to-point MIMO system, including the maximum likelihood (ML) estimation and minimum mean square error (MMSE) estimation, as well as their counterparts least square (LS) estimation and linear minimum mean square error (LMMSE) estimation. Moreover, the channel estimation for the amplify-and-forward (AF) unidirectional relaying system (URS) is also discussed, which is seen to be quite different from that of the point-to-point system. One should identify the “needed” channel parameters in URS and then carry out the corresponding estimation. Finally, we discuss the differences of the channel estimation in PLNC system and present the new challenges compared to the other systems.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/301951337_Background_on_Channel_Estimation">6 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel Estimation for PLNC Under Time-Selective Fading Scenario"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2014-09-16"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/images/template/default_publication_preview_large.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/316046683_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Time-Selective_Fading_Scenario"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/316046683_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Time-Selective_Fading_Scenario" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Channel Estimation for PLNC Under Time-Selective Fading Scenario</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/316046683_Channel_Estimation_for_PLNC_Under_Time-Selective_Fading_Scenario">Chapter</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Sep 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Channel Estimation for Physical Layer Network Coding Systems</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this chapter, we design channel estimation and training sequence for PLNC in a time-selective fading environment. We first propose a new complex-exponential basis expansion model (CE-BEM) to represent the mobile-to-mobile time-varying channels. To estimate such channels, a novel pilot symbol-aided transmission scheme is developed such that a low complex linear approach can be applied to estimate the BEM coefficients of the convoluted channels. More essentially, we design two algorithms to extract the BEM coefficients of the individual channels. The optimal training parameters, including the number of the pilot symbols, the placement of the pilot symbols, and the power allocation to the pilot symbols, are derived by minimizing the channel mean-square error (MSE). Finally, extensive numerical results are provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/271437103_Cognitive_transmission_and_performance_analysis_for_Amplify-and-Forward_two-way_relay_networks"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/271437103_Cognitive_transmission_and_performance_analysis_for_Amplify-and-Forward_two-way_relay_networks" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Cognitive transmission and performance analysis for Amplify-and-Forward two-way relay networks</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/271437103_Cognitive_transmission_and_performance_analysis_for_Amplify-and-Forward_two-way_relay_networks">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jun 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">ICC 2014 - 2014 IEEE International Conference on Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2064879442_Jianhua_Lu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jianhua Lu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jianhua Lu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2064879442_Jianhua_Lu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we propose a cognitive transmission scheme for Amplify-and-Forward (AF) two-way relay networks (TWRNs) and investigate its joint sensing and transmission performance. Specifically, we derive the overall false alarm probability, the overall detection probability, the outage probability of the cognitive TWRN over Rayleigh fading channels. Furthermore, based on these probabilities, the spectrum hole utilization efficiency of the cognitive TWRN is defined and evaluated. It is shown that smaller individual or overall false alarm probability can result in less outage probability and thus larger spectrum hole utilization efficiency for cognitive TWRN, and also produce more interference to the primary users. Interestingly, it is found that given data rate, more transmission power for the cognitive TWRN does not necessarily obtain higher spectrum hole utilization efficiency. Moreover, our results show that a maximum spectrum hole utilization efficiency can be achieved through an optimal allocation of the time slots between the spectrum sensing and data transmission phases. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/271437103_Cognitive_transmission_and_performance_analysis_for_Amplify-and-Forward_two-way_relay_networks"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yang_Liu627" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Xin_Liu172" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xin Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Xin_Liu172"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Xiyuan_Wang2" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/277530746605572-1443179894571_Q64/Xiyuan_Wang2.jpg" alt="Xiyuan Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xiyuan Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Xiyuan_Wang2"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this letter, we study the beamforming and user selection problem in multicast MISO wiretap-channel, where a base station (BS) with N_t antennas broadcasts a common confidential message to M legitimate users (Bobs) and N unauthorized users (Eves) attempt to eavesdrop the message. We target at maximizing the minimum secrecy-outage rate of Bobs and propose an iterative successive convex approximation (SCA) algorithm to tackle the original nonconvex problem. We further develop joint semidefinite programming (SDP) and SCA algorithm to find a feasible subset where legitimate users are guaranteed to their requirements. Simulation results are provided to evaluate the proposed approaches.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2064839120_Bin_Sun" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Bin Sun" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Bin Sun</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2064839120_Bin_Sun"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046630557_Likun_Yang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Likun Yang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Likun Yang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046630557_Likun_Yang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, an encryption key generation algorithm is suggested for multiple-relay networks against eavesdropping. The proposed algorithm is based on the parameters of the wireless channels between the relays nodes and the destination, which is unavailable for any eavesdropper. The secure performance of the proposed algorithm is also analyzed through mathematical derivation. Specifically, the closed form of key matching probability, an important measure for secure performance, is obtained through multiple-round integration and reasonable approximation. Finally, simulations are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/273396871_Security_and_Reliability_Performance_Analysis_for_Cloud_Radio_Access_Networks_With_Channel_Estimation_Errors/links/5818c37e08ae1f34d24aa672/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/273396871_Security_and_Reliability_Performance_Analysis_for_Cloud_Radio_Access_Networks_With_Channel_Estimation_Errors"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/273396871_Security_and_Reliability_Performance_Analysis_for_Cloud_Radio_Access_Networks_With_Channel_Estimation_Errors" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Security and Reliability Performance Analysis for Cloud Radio Access Networks With Channel Estimation Errors</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/273396871_Security_and_Reliability_Performance_Analysis_for_Cloud_Radio_Access_Networks_With_Channel_Estimation_Errors">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2014</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Access</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia You" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia You</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Physical layer (PHY) security is recently regarded as a promising technique to improve the security performance of wireless communication networks. Current developments in PHY security are often based on the assumption of perfect channel state information (CSI). In this paper, both security and reliability performance for the downlink cloud radio access network with optimal remote radio heads (RRHs) node selection are investigated in a practical scenario by considering channel estimation (CE) errors. In particular, a three-phase transmission scheme is proposed and the linear minimum mean-square error (MMSE) estimation method is utilized to obtain the CSI. Based on the CSI estimates and the statistics of CE errors, the outage probability and intercept probability are derived in closed-form expression to evaluate the security and reliability performance, respectively. In addition, two possible cases (with or without intercepting signals from baseband unit) are considered for the eavesdropper. It is found that the suggested optimal RRHs selection scheme outperforms the nonselection scheme, and that the increasing number of RRHs can lower the outage probability as well as the intercept probability. It is also shown that there exists an optimal training number to minimize the sum of the outage probability and intercept probability. Finally, simulation results are provided to corroborate our proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2014</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chengwen_Xing" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/284950000619521-1444948782548_Q64/Chengwen_Xing.jpg" alt="Chengwen Xing" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chengwen Xing</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chengwen_Xing"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This SpringerBrief presents channel estimation strategies for the physical later network coding (PLNC) systems. Along with a review of PLNC architectures, this brief examines new challenges brought by the special structure of bi-directional two-hop transmissions that are different from the traditional point-to-point systems and unidirectional relay systems. The authors discuss the channel estimation strategies over typical fading scenarios, including frequency flat fading, frequency selective fading and time selective fading, as well as future research directions. Chapters explore the performance of the channel estimation strategy and optimal structure of training sequences for each scenario. Besides the analysis of channel estimation strategies, the book also points out the necessity of revisiting other signal processing issues for the PLNC system. Channel Estimation of Physical Layer Network Coding Systems is a valuable resource for researchers and professionals working in wireless communications and networks. Advanced-level students studying computer science and electrical engineering will also find the content helpful.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Security-reliability tradeoff for secure wireless communications with channel estimation error"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2013-11-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/269326342_Security-reliability_tradeoff_for_secure_wireless_communications_with_channel_estimation_error/links/5819e43608ae30a2c01c8aa3/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/269326342_Security-reliability_tradeoff_for_secure_wireless_communications_with_channel_estimation_error"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading nova-v-publication-item__figures nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/269326342_Security-reliability_tradeoff_for_secure_wireless_communications_with_channel_estimation_error" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Security-reliability tradeoff for secure wireless communications with channel estimation error</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/269326342_Security-reliability_tradeoff_for_secure_wireless_communications_with_channel_estimation_error">Conference Paper</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/269326342_Security-reliability_tradeoff_for_secure_wireless_communications_with_channel_estimation_error">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Nov 2013</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">2013 International Workshop on High Mobility Wireless Communications (HMWC)</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yulong_Zou3" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/533351569735680-1504172331285_Q64/Yulong_Zou3.jpg" alt="Yulong Zou" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yulong Zou</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yulong_Zou3"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we identify and analyze the tradeoff between security and reliability for wireless communications in the presence of eavesdropping attack. Typically, we assume that both destination and the eavesdropper can only obtain channel state information with estimation errors, instead of perfect channel estimation predominantly assumed in the literature. Linear minimum mean-square error estimation (LMMSE) is performed and the expressions for data throughput of the main link and the wiretap link are derived considering estimation errors. Next the probability that an outage event occurs over the main link, named outage probability, is given to represent the reliability. Meanwhile, the probability that an eavesdropper succeeds in intercepting the source signal, called intercept probability, is found to measure the security. Based on these, the security-reliability tradeoff performance is analyzed and it is shown that the transmission security (reliability) can be improved by loosening the reliability (security) requirement. Simulations are then provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Doubly selective channel estimation class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li and Networking in China (CHINACOM), 2013 8th International ICST Conference on</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046630557_Likun_Yang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Likun Yang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Likun Yang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046630557_Likun_Yang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Doubly selective channel estimation is considered for a two-way relay network (TWRN) that comprises two source terminals and an amplify-and-forward (AF) relay. The channel is depicted by complex exponential basis expansion model (CE-BEM). It is found that estimating all channel parameters require long training sequence and thus reduce the transmission efficiency. Therefore, estimation algorithm is proposed to estimate some combined channels, and the corresponding Cramer—Rao bound (CRB) is derived. Based on these estimates, detection of the information symbols can be realized at the source nodes. Finally, simulations are provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Measurements and Analysis of Propagation Channels in High-Speed Railway Viaducts"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2013-02-01"/><meta itemProp="image"
