itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/260582762_Measurements_and_Analysis_of_Propagation_Channels_in_High-Speed_Railway_Viaducts"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/260582762_Measurements_and_Analysis_of_Propagation_Channels_in_High-Speed_Railway_Viaducts" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Measurements and Analysis of Propagation Channels in High-Speed Railway Viaducts</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/260582762_Measurements_and_Analysis_of_Propagation_Channels_in_High-Speed_Railway_Viaducts">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/260582762_Measurements_and_Analysis_of_Propagation_Channels_in_High-Speed_Railway_Viaducts">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Feb 2013</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Ruisi_He" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ruisi He" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Ruisi He</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Ruisi_He"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Bo_Ai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="bo ai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">bo ai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Bo_Ai"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/10131195_Andreas_F_Molisch" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Andreas F. Molisch" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Andreas F. Molisch</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/10131195_Andreas_F_Molisch"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper reports (i) a set of measurements of the wireless propagation channel at 930 MHz, conducted along the &quot;Zhengzhou-Xian&quot; high-speed railway of China in various railway viaduct scenarios, and (ii) an analysis and modeling of the small-scale and large-scale channel parameters based on those measurements. The environment can be categorized into four cases, covering viaducts with different heights and in different suburban environments. Small values of fade depth, level crossing rates, and average fade duration are observed. Akaike&#x27;s Information Criterion (AIC)-based evaluation indicates that the Ricean distribution is the best to describe small-scale amplitude fading. An analysis of the envelope autocovariance function shows that the coherence distance is less than 10 cm. The Ricean K-factor is modeled as a piecewise-linear function of distance. Moreover, a breakpoint path loss model is developed and shadow fading is investigated using the same break point as for the distance-dependent K-factor model. The Suzuki distribution is found to offer a good fit for the composite multipath/shadowing channels. We find that the viaduct height H, together with the number of surrounding scatterers, significantly affects the small- and large-scale channel parameters. These results are applicable to both normal-speed and high-speed railways, and will be useful in the modeling of railway viaduct channels and the design of railway wireless communication systems.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/260582762_Measurements_and_Analysis_of_Propagation_Channels_in_High-Speed_Railway_Viaducts"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list Amplify-and-Forward Two-Way Relay Networks with Channel Estimation Errors</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2013</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">5th IET International Conference on Wireless, Mobile and Multimedia Networks (ICWMMN 2013)</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yang_Liu627" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Yang Liu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yang Liu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yang_Liu627"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongtao_Xu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/454443952021506-1485359289272_Q64/Rongtao_Xu.jpg" alt="Rongtao Xu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongtao Xu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongtao_Xu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we study the channel estimation and data detection problem for secure Amplify-and-Forward two-way relay networks. It is shown that for the eavesdropper node, the signal processing process of channel estimation and data detection is quiet different from that of the destination node. The channel estimation errors of both the legal user and the eavesdropper are studied. Next we derive the closed-form expression of channel capacity with imperfect channel state information. Simulations are then provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/271466246_Performance_Analysis_of_Optimal_Relay_Selective_Cooperation_in_Railway_Network" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Performance Analysis of Optimal Relay Selective Cooperation in Railway Network</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2013</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">5th IET International Conference on Wireless, Mobile and Multimedia Networks (ICWMMN 2013)</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia You" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia You</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70123649_Shan_Yang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Shan Yang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Shan Yang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70123649_Shan_Yang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In the railway network, the fact that signal amplitude suffers loss resulted from signal traversing through the carriage which named by carriage pass loss, highly influences the reliability of the wireless communication system. In this paper, we propose an optimal relay selective cooperation (ORSC) scheme without the acknowledgment from the destination as if it succeeds in decoding or not. The main purpose of this paper is to evaluate the performance of ORSC transmission schemes. Specifically, the closed-form outage probabilities for ORSC transmission scheme are derived. By comparing obtained outage probability of ORSC with the non-cooperation transmission scheme, we find the ORSC transmission has better performance, better reliability and significantly eliminates the impact of the carriage passing loss.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack sequences and Reed-Muller codes based PAPR reduction for relay networks with superimposed training</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Oct 2012</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">2012 11th International Conference on Signal Processing (ICSP 2012)</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2064970223_Ge_Bai" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Ge Bai" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Ge Bai</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2064970223_Ge_Bai"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongtao_Xu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/454443952021506-1485359289272_Q64/Rongtao_Xu.jpg" alt="Rongtao Xu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongtao Xu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongtao_Xu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2064819849_Zhiyong_Qin" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhiyong Qin" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhiyong Qin</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2064819849_Zhiyong_Qin"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Thanks to relay network having the advantage of diversity and signal covering, lots of researches that require perfect channel estimation on relay network is undertaken. The superimposed training technique can estimate both the channel between source and relay and the channel between relay and destination pretty well. However, with orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) being widely used, peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR) must be concerned. In this work, we apply a coding scheme based on Golay complementary sequences and Reed-Muller (RM) Codes into the system to reduce PAPR. Simulation results show that the proposed scheme does well in PAPR reduction.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/271502433_Golay_complementary_sequences_and_Reed-Muller_codes_based_PAPR_reduction_for_relay_networks_with_superimposed_training"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/271502433_Golay_complementary_sequences_and_Reed-Muller_codes_based_PAPR_reduction_for_relay_networks_with_superimposed_training">13 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Aug 2012</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Communications and Networking in China (CHINACOM), 2012 7th International ICST Conference on</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046178036_Xuena_Li" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Xuena Li" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Xuena Li</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046178036_Xuena_Li"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Hao_Jin3" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Hao Jin" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Hao Jin</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Hao_Jin3"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Jiamo_Jiang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jiamo Jiang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jiamo Jiang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Jiamo_Jiang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><span class="nova-v-publication-item__person-list-truncation">[...]</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Fractional frequency reuse (FFR) is an inter-cell interference coordination (ICIC) scheme wherein the whole bandwidth is divided into regions using different frequency reuse factors in orthogonal frequency division multiple access (OFDMA) networks. However, it is hard to achieve the balance of cell-edge and cell-center user throughput in practice as all base stations (BS) are configured with static transmission power for each sub-band in traditional FFR. To solve this problem, a gradient projection based self-optimizing (GPB-SO) algorithm for ICIC is proposed to adjust transmission power of each sub-bands set by exchanging the gradient direction information, aiming to maximize the overall network utility. Furthermore, a closed-form of gradient direction is attained to update the transmission power of each BS in a distributed manner. With the simulation results, it is demonstrated that the proposed algorithm not only provides a better tradeoff between spectrum efficiency and cell-edge user throughput, but also increases the system energy efficiency due to interference reduction.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Transmission schemes for high-speed railway: Direct or relay?"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2012-08-01"/><meta itemProp="image" nova-v-publication-item__figures--size-big"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__container"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/261384805_Transmission_schemes_for_high-speed_railway_Direct_or_relay" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Transmission schemes for high-speed railway: Direct or relay?</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/261384805_Transmission_schemes_for_high-speed_railway_Direct_or_relay">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Aug 2012</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing Conference (IWCMC), 2012 8th International</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jia You" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jia You</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/2046486557_Jia_You"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Zhangdui Zhong" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Zhangdui Zhong</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/70858057_Zhangdui_Zhong"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Rongtao_Xu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/454443952021506-1485359289272_Q64/Rongtao_Xu.jpg" alt="Rongtao Xu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Rongtao Xu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Rongtao_Xu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Two transmission schemes exist in wireless communication system for high-speed railway: the direct transmission and relay-based transmission. The main purpose of this paper is to evaluate the performance of these two transmission schemes. Specifically, the closed-form expressions of ergodic capacity for each transmission scheme are derived. By comparing these obtained capacity expressions, we find that the relay-based transmission has better performance in the low and intermediate SNR, while the direct transmission becomes a better choice at high SNR. It is also shown that the signal amplitude loss resulted from signal traversing through the carriage is a key parameter in determining the ergodic capacity for direct transmission scheme. Finally, the simulation results demonstrate an exact match with our theoretical findings.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/34466199_Jiaru_Lin" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Jiaru Lin" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Jiaru Lin</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/34466199_Jiaru_Lin"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, the estimation of doubly selective channel is considered for amplify-and-forward (AF) relay networks. The complex exponential basis expansion model (CE-BEM) is chosen to describe the time-varying channel, from which the infinite channel parameters are mapped onto finite ones. Since direct estimation of these coefficients encounters high computational complexity and large spectral cost, we develop an efficient estimator targeting at some specially defined channel parameters. The training sequence design that can minimize the channel estimation mean-square error is also proposed.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/220127857_Channel_Estimation_and_Training_Design_for_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_in_Time-Selective_Fading_Environments"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/220127857_Channel_Estimation_and_Training_Design_for_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_in_Time-Selective_Fading_Environments" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Channel Estimation and Training Design for Two-Way Relay Networks in Time-Selective Fading Environments</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/220127857_Channel_Estimation_and_Training_Design_for_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_in_Time-Selective_Fading_Environments">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Aug 2011</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Wen_Chen25" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272861654941709-1442066696487_Q64/Wen_Chen25.jpg" alt="Wen Chen" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Wen Chen</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Wen_Chen25"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, channel estimation and training sequence design are considered for amplify-and-forward (AF)-based two-way relay networks (TWRNs) in a time-selective fading environment. A new complex-exponential basis expansion model (CE-BEM) is proposed to represent the mobile-to-mobile time-varying channels. To estimate such channels, a novel pilot symbol-aided transmission scheme is developed such that a low complex linear approach can estimate the BEM coefficients of the convoluted channels. More essentially, two algorithms are designed to extract the BEM coefficients of the individual channels. The optimal training parameters, including the number of the pilot symbols, the placement of the pilot symbols, and the power allocation to the pilot symbols, are derived by minimizing the channel mean-square error (MSE). The selections of the system parameters are thoroughly discussed in order to guide practical system design. Finally, extensive numerical results are provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link Estimation for Two-Way Relay Networks under Time-Selective Environment</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/221167678_Channel_Estimation_for_Two-Way_Relay_Networks_under_Time-Selective_Environment">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jun 2011</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Proceedings of IEEE International Conference on Communications, ICC 2011, Kyoto, Japan, 5-9 June, 2011</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Wen_Chen25" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272861654941709-1442066696487_Q64/Wen_Chen25.jpg" alt="Wen Chen" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Wen Chen</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Wen_Chen25"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we consider the problem of channel estimation for two-way relay networks (TWRN) under time- selective environment. We first parameterize the time-varying channels by the basis expansion model (BEM) and then propose a novel pilot symbol aided modulation (PSAM) for TWRN. A linear approach to estimate the cascaded channels is designed and the optimal training sequences are derived based on minimizing the mean-square error (MSE) criterion. Moreover, we develop an algorithm to recover the individual channel knowledge with which both the channel estimation accuracy and the system performance can be improved. Various simulations are provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Channel estimation with amplitude constraint: Superimposed training or conventional training ?"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2011-05-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/252006311_Channel_estimation_with_amplitude_constraint_Superimposed_training_or_conventional_training/links/5819d94508aeffb29412e724/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/252006311_Channel_estimation_with_amplitude_constraint_Superimposed_training_or_conventional_training"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/252006311_Channel_estimation_with_amplitude_constraint_Superimposed_training_or_conventional_training" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Channel estimation with amplitude constraint: Superimposed training or conventional training ?</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/252006311_Channel_estimation_with_amplitude_constraint_Superimposed_training_or_conventional_training">Article</a></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__fulltext" href="publication/252006311_Channel_estimation_with_amplitude_constraint_Superimposed_training_or_conventional_training">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">May 2011</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper utilizes a general superimposed training based transmission scheme that includes superimposed training and pilot symbol assisted modulation (PSAM) as special cases. The channel estimator of the scheme is the linear minimum mean square error (LMMSE) estimator. By taking into account errors of this method, we derive the closed-form lower bound of the data throughput under the constraint of limited amplitude for each symbol. Our study shows that with the constraint of total amplitude for each symbol, the conventional PSAM performs better in the high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) region whileat low SNR, the superimposed scheme performs better. I. I NTRODUCTION</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/220970816_Data-dependent_channel_estimation_and_superimposed_training_design_in_amplify_and_forward_relay_networks" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Data-dependent channel estimation and superimposed training design in amplify and forward relay networks</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Mar 2011</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">2011 IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference, WCNC 2011, Proceedings, Cancun, Mexico, 28-31 March, 2011</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/69862472_Guoqing_Li" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Guoqing Li" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Guoqing Li</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/69862472_Guoqing_Li"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, we apply the data-dependent su- perimposed training (DDST) in amplify-and-forward (AF) relay networks with cyclic-prefix single carrier (CPSC) modulation. We consider various issues such as channel estimation, training design and data detection. A sub-optimal training sequence that can minimize the upper bound of the mean square error of the estimator is derived. Since the DDST estimator can only find the overall channel information, we further propose a doubly cooperative estimator (DCE) to track the individual channel knowledge at the cost of some performance loss. Simulations are then provided to corroborate the proposed studies.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Joint CFO and channel estimation for OFDM-based two-way relay network"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2011-03-01"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network/links/0046352a269dedfd10000000/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><span><div><div class="nova-c-image-strip is-preloading class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div><div class="nova-c-image-strip__item"><div class="nova-c-image-strip__placeholder"></div></div></div></div></div></span></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-l nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__title nova-v-publication-item__title--clamp-3" itemProp="headline"><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network" itemProp="mainEntityOfPage">Joint CFO and channel estimation for OFDM-based two-way relay network</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m nova-v-publication-item__type" href="publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network">Full-text available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Mar 2011</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Yik_Chung_Wu" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279348608290821-1443613306378_Q64/Yik_Chung_Wu.jpg" alt="Yik-Chung Wu" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Yik-Chung Wu</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Yik_Chung_Wu"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">Joint estimation of the carrier frequency offset (CFO) and the channel is developed for a two-way relay network (TWRN) that comprises two source terminals and an amplify-and-forward (AF) relay. The terminals use orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM). New zero-padding (ZP) and cyclic-prefix (CP) transmission protocols, which maintain the carrier orthogonality and ensure low estimation and detection complexity, are proposed. Both protocols lead to the same estimation problem which can be solved by the nulling-based least square (LS) algorithm and perform identically when the block length is large. We present detailed performance analysis by proving the unbiasedness of the LS estimators at high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) and by deriving the closed-form expression of the mean-square-error (MSE). Simulation results are provided to corroborate our findings.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-pack nova-o-pack--gutter-m nova-o-pack--width-auto nova-o-pack--vertical-align-middle"><div class="nova-o-pack__item nova-v-publication-item__footer-button-group"><div><div class="nova-c-button-group nova-c-button-group--gutter-m nova-c-button-group--orientation-horizontal nova-c-button-group--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__actions"><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"><a class="nova-c-button nova-c-button--align-center nova-c-button--radius-m nova-c-button--size-s nova-c-button--color-blue nova-c-button--theme-bare nova-c-button--width-auto nova-v-publication-item__action" href="publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network"><span class="nova-c-button__label">View</span></a></div><div class="nova-c-button-group__item"></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-metrics"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__metrics"><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"></li><li class="nova-e-list__item nova-v-publication-item__metrics-item"><span><a class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/224203278_Joint_CFO_and_channel_estimation_for_OFDM-based_two-way_relay_network">79 Reads</a></span></li></ul></div></footer></div></div></div><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="BEM-Based Estimation for Time-Varying Channels and Training Design in Two-Way Relay Networks"/><meta itemProp="datePublished" content="2011-01-10"/><meta itemProp="image" content="https://i1.rgstatic.net/publication/224210652_BEM-Based_Estimation_for_Time-Varying_Channels_and_Training_Design_in_Two-Way_Relay_Networks/links/0046352a269de6fc69000000/preview.png"/><meta itemProp="mainEntityOfPage" content="publication/224210652_BEM-Based_Estimation_for_Time-Varying_Channels_and_Training_Design_in_Two-Way_Relay_Networks"/><div class="nova-v-publication-item__body"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack nova-v-publication-item__stack--gutter-m"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text class="nova-e-link nova-e-link--color-inherit nova-e-link--theme-bare" href="publication/224210652_BEM-Based_Estimation_for_Time-Varying_Channels_and_Training_Design_in_Two-Way_Relay_Networks" class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-left"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-high nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-solid nova-e-badge--radius-m class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Jan 2011</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Global Telecommunications Conference (GLOBECOM 2010), 2010 IEEE</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">In this paper, channel estimation for two-way relay networks (TWRNs) over time-varying channels is investigated. We consider the amplify-and-forward (AF) relaying scheme and adopt the complex-exponential basis expansion model (CE-BEM) that represents the time-varying channel by a finite number of parameters. We develop the estimation methods for both the cascaded channels and the individual channels and also apply the total least square (TLS) algorithm to improve the estimation accuracy. Moreover, the training design is discussed and a heuristic criterion is proposed to minimize the condition number of the estimation matrix. The simulation results verify the goodness of the criterion.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div class="nova-o-stack__item"><div><div itemType="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle" itemscope="" class="nova-v-publication-item"><meta itemProp="headline" content="Superimposed Pilot Based Joint CFO Channel Estimation for CP-OFDM Modulated Two-Way Relay Networks</a></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__badges-item"><a class="nova-e-badge nova-e-badge--color-green nova-e-badge--display-block nova-e-badge--luminosity-medium nova-e-badge--size-l nova-e-badge--theme-ghost available</a></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__meta-right"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none custom-publication-item__meta-data"><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Dec 2010</span></li><li class="nova-e-list__item custom-publication-item__meta-data-item"><span class="">Proceedings of the Global Communications Conference, 2010. GLOBECOM 2010, 6-10 December 2010, Miami, Florida, USA</span></li></ul></div></div></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><ul class="nova-e-list nova-e-list--size-m nova-e-list--type-inline nova-e-list--spacing-none nova-v-publication-item__person-list"><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Gongpu_Wang" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/279517332557828-1443653533101_Q64/Gongpu_Wang.jpg" alt="Gongpu Wang" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Gongpu Wang</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Gongpu_Wang"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://c5.rgstatic.net/m/4671872220764/images/template/default/profile/profile_default_m.jpg" alt="Feifei Gao" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Feifei Gao</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="scientific-contributions/12921948_Feifei_Gao"/></span></a></li><li class="nova-e-list__item"><a href="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura" class="nova-v-person-inline-item" itemProp="author" itemscope="" itemType="http://schema.org/Person"><div class="nova-e-avatar nova-e-avatar--size-xs nova-e-avatar--radius-full nova-v-person-inline-item__image"><img src="https://i1.rgstatic.net/ii/profile.image/272452089544732-1441969048796_Q64/Chinthananda_Tellambura.jpg" alt="Chinthananda Tellambura" itemProp="image" class="nova-e-avatar__img"/></div><span itemProp="name" class="nova-v-person-inline-item__fullname">Chinthananda Tellambura</span><span><meta itemProp="url" content="profile/Chinthananda_Tellambura"/></span></a></li></ul></div><div class="nova-v-publication-item__stack-item"><div class="nova-e-text nova-e-text--size-m nova-e-text--family-sans-serif nova-e-text--spacing-none nova-e-text--color-inherit nova-v-publication-item__description nova-v-publication-item__description--clamp-3" itemProp="description">This paper proposes a superimposed training strategy to estimate the individual frequency and channel parameters in an amplify-and-forward (AF) two-way relay network (TWRN). Two efficient suboptimal estimation algorithms and an iterative process to further improve the performance are proposed. The estimation Cramér-Rao Bound (CRB) on the proposed estimation strategy is also derived. The simulations confirm that the iterative estimation process converges rapidly and that the resultant estimation mean square error (MSE) approaches the CRB, especially for the case when the carrier frequency offset between the two source terminals is small.</div></div></div></div><footer class="nova-v-publication-item__footer"><div class="nova-v-publication-item__footer-actions"><div
